educations.schoolName: Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey

headline: Navy veteran and 2013 PMF finalist.
summary: Ronald is a U.S. Navy veteran and 2013 Presidential Management Fellowship (PMF) finalist, seeking a career as an intellgence or fraud analyst. As a graduate student, Ronald has analyzed numerous terrorist organizations with varying religions and ideologies. Ronald has also evaluated counterterrorism policies and methods as they pertain to current terrorism organizations and is knowledgeable about the basic policies and science of chemical, biological, and nuclear weapons. Ronald has excellent communication, organizational and management skills and is well organized and efficient with the ability to multi-task while working in a fast-paced environment.

positions.companyName: The Office of Senator Jon Kyl
positions.description:
â¢Focused on exceptional customer service on the phone and in-person, by guiding constituents who were having difficulty with the various federal agencies such as the Internal Revenue Service, the Social Security Administration and the Veterans Administration.
â¢Assisted constituents in acquiring visas for family members or contacting foreign governments on their behalf. 
â¢Preformed data entry in order to log constituents political concerns and also entered data for constituent services. 
â¢Organized and modernized years of paper files by scanning documents and creating a system on the computer network, enabling the staff to search by the constituents name or situation. 
â¢Excelled in a fast-paced, federal environment where confidentiality was essential.
positions.title: Intern

positions.description:
â¢Managed the Spare Material Storage Room, which included the accurate inventory, issue, and receipt of $175,000 worth of consumable items. Meticulous attention to detail led to zero discrepancies over a three-quarter period.

â¢Attained Quality Assurance certifications in both Parachute Division and Floatation Device division responsible for overseeing quality of aircraft survival equipment performed by personal. 
â¢Ensured completion of administrative and data entry functions regarding aviation policies and procedures in compliance with Naval Aviation, FAA and OSHA regulations. 
â¢Mentored and advised teamâs career development, preparing them for promotion, relocation, and military legal issues.

â¢Received two âGood Conductâ medals for outstanding professional achievement.
positions.title: Petty Officer 2nd Class - Supervisor / Quality Assurance Inspector
